postTemplates.with-hero-without-title: With the hero section without title

customConfig.name: pageWidth
customConfig.label: Main page width
customConfig.note: Use of "rem" units recommended; also use others (px, vw)

customConfig.name: entryWidth
customConfig.label: Content width
customConfig.note: Use of "rem" units recommended; also use others (px, vw)

customConfig.name: frontPost
customConfig.label: Posts
customConfig.note: We strongly recommended 'hide' and 'noindex' the selected post to avoid the duplicate content issue.

customConfig.name: frontGallery
customConfig.note: Enable if you want to display a post with image gallery

options.label: With the hero section without title

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note: If you have selected a "Grid view" layout above, you can now specify the following grid options:

customConfig.name: gridGap
customConfig.label: Grid Gap
customConfig.note: Define the size of the gap between the rows and columns

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note: The following settings have an impact on all pages: homepage, tags and authors

customConfig.name: listingFeaturedImageBorderRadius
customConfig.label: Create rounded images
customConfig.note: Specify the border-radius in px

customConfig.name: dividerWidth
customConfig.label: Separator width
customConfig.note: Specify the width of divider in %

customConfig.name: submenuWidth
customConfig.note: The submenu width in PX unit

customConfig.name: hero
customConfig.label: Type
customConfig.note: Slider mode displays only posts that have been marked as Featured in the post edit screen.

customConfig.name: heroHeight
customConfig.label: Height of section
customConfig.note: Use of "rem" units recommended; also use others (px, vh), for full-height set to 100vh

customConfig.name: uploadHeroAlt
customConfig.label: Image Alt text
customConfig.placeholder: Add an alternative text to the hero image

customConfig.name: textHero
customConfig.label: Text
customConfig.value:
This is a sample of static hero section

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit. Aenean commodo ligula eget dolor. Aenean massa. Cum sociis natoque penatibus et magnis dis parturient montes

customConfig.name: heroSliderLoop
customConfig.label: Loop
customConfig.note: Moves throughout all the slides seamlessly

customConfig.name: heroSliderSpeed
customConfig.label: Speed
customConfig.note: Time between slides in milliseconds (1000ms = 1s)

customConfig.name: heroSliderAutoplayTimeout
customConfig.label: Autoplay timeout
customConfig.note: Autoplay timeout in milliseconds (1000ms = 1s)

customConfig.name: heroSliderLazyload
customConfig.label: Lazyload
customConfig.note: Enables lazyloading images that are currently not viewed, thus saving bandwidth.

customConfig.name: heroLabel
customConfig.label: Label
customConfig.note: Display the label over the title of the hero section

customConfig.name: bottomNewsTagIndicator
customConfig.label: Source
customConfig.note: This section displays six posts from the selected tag

customConfig.name: copyrightText
customConfig.label: Text
customConfig.value: Powered by Publii

customConfig.name: contentBoxShadowRadius
customConfig.label: Content shadow radius
customConfig.note: Specify the border-radius in px

customConfig.name: separator

customConfig.note: Available while scrolling back to the top of the website.

customConfig.name: stickyBoxShadowRadius
customConfig.label: Bottom shadow radius
customConfig.note: Specify the border-radius in px

customConfig.name: heroOverlayGradientDirection
customConfig.note: Gradient direction

customConfig.name: fontFamily
customConfig.label: Font family
customConfig.note:
The 'OS Default Font' option will use the native system fonts of the browser your site visitors are using, providing a boost to speed and performance.

Please note: when using Google Fonts, the IP address of your website visitors will be sent to Google to allow the correct fonts to be downloaded to their browser. The Google Fonts API limits the collection, storage and use of end-user data only to what is needed to deliver the fonts efficiently.

options.label: OS Default Font + OS Default Font

customConfig.name: minFontSize
customConfig.label: Min.
customConfig.note: The font-size of the root element in REM unit

customConfig.name: maxFontSize
customConfig.label: Max.
customConfig.note: The font-size of the root element in REM unit

customConfig.name: lineHeight
customConfig.label: Line height
customConfig.note: The default line-height for the entire website

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Headings
customConfig.note: Please note: not all of the font weights are working with the fonts listed above.

customConfig.name: shareTwitterName
customConfig.note: Enter your Twitter account's handle here; it will be used when the Twitter share button is clicked on your site e.g. 'via @TwitterHandle'. If left blank, the default username of @SiteName will be used

customConfig.name: commentDisqusShortname
customConfig.label: Disqus shortname
customConfig.note:
A shortname is the unique identifier assigned to a Disqus site. Please visit https://help.disqus.com/ to find more details.

Do not forget to enable comments under Post View tab.

customConfig.name: searchId
customConfig.label: Google Custom Search Id
customConfig.note: A search ID is required for search functionality, which uses Google Custom Search. Learn how to configure it here: https://www.getpublii.com/docs/...

customConfig.name: searchParam
customConfig.label: Search parameter
customConfig.note: You can change the default "q" search parameter if desired; this is recommended only for advanced users.

customConfig.name: galleryItemGap
customConfig.label: Item spacing
customConfig.note: Use of REM units recommended but you can also use others (px, vw,)

customConfig.name: galleryLightboxStyle
customConfig.label: Lightbox style
customConfig.note: Set the lightbox slideshow style by choosing dark or light overlay

customConfig.name: galleryLightboxOpacity
customConfig.note: Adjust the lightbox overlay transparency

customConfig.name: galleryPreloader
customConfig.label: Preloader
customConfig.note: Loading indicator is displayed with 1s delay, so if the photo loads faster it will be invisible.

customConfig.name: galleryCloseOnScroll
customConfig.label: Close gallery on page scroll
customConfig.note: Option works just for devices without hardware touch support.

customConfig.name: galleryArrowKeys
customConfig.label: Keyboard navigation
customConfig.note: Keyboard left or right arrow key navigation.

customConfig.name: newsletterFormCode
customConfig.note:
Before pasting your code, learn how to make your newsletter form as functional and visually-appealing as possible. Learn more

Remember to add a "newsletter-popup__submit" class to the submit button for the proper working of the newsletter popup.

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.note: Display a newsletter popup when scrolling or after a delay. Both options can be enabled at once; if neither are enabled the popup will not be displayed.

customConfig.name: newsletterScrollDistance
customConfig.label: Scroll distance
customConfig.note: Displays the popup after the user has scrolled a specified amount from the top of the page - the scroll distance must be provided in pixels.

customConfig.name: newsletterTimeLength
customConfig.label: Delay start
customConfig.note: Displays a popup after the specified time has elapsed - the delay start value should be entered in milliseconds.

customConfig.name: pagePrefetching
customConfig.label: On / Off
customConfig.note: Speeds-up page-loads after the initial load by prefetching in-viewport links during idle time. When enabled, it will check the current browser window for any links, then, if the browser isn't doing anything and the user isn't on a slow connection, it will start pre-loading the linked URLs so that the content will be ready when the link is clicked.

options.label: Custom - create your own date format

customConfig.name: formatDateCustom
customConfig.label: Create a custom date format
customConfig.note: More details you can find here.

customConfig.name: lazyLoadEffect
customConfig.label: Lazy load effects
customConfig.note: This option works only if the 'Media lazy load' option is enabled in the Website Speed tab under Site Settings

customConfig.name: faviconUpload
customConfig.label: Upload file
customConfig.note: The ideal size of a favicon is 16x16 pixels. Save your favicon as either favicon.png or favicon.ico
